about.description:
Classified Advertisements (classads) are the lingua franca of
HTCondor. They are used for describing jobs, workstations, and other
resources. They are exchanged by HTCondor processes to schedule
jobs. They are logged to files for statistical and debugging
purposes. They are used to enquire about current state of the system.

A classad is a mapping from attribute names to expressions. In the
simplest cases, the expressions are simple constants (integer,
floating point, or string). A classad is thus a form of property
list. Attribute expressions can also be more complicated. There is a
protocol for evaluating an attribute expression of a classad vis a vis
another ad. For example, the expression "other.size > 3" in one ad
evaluates to true if the other ad has an attribute named size and the
value of that attribute is (or evaluates to) an integer greater than
three. Two classads match if each ad has an attribute requirements
that evaluates to true in the context of the other ad. Classad
matching is used by the HTCondor central manager to determine the
compatibility of jobs and workstations where they may be run.

name: htcondor-classads
raw_recipe:
# This file created by conda-build 3.25.0
# ------------------------------------------------

package:
  name: htcondor-classads
  version: 10.0.6
source:
  patches:
    - 0001-cmake-don-t-build-daemons.patch
    - 0002-cmake-set-C_PYTHONARCHLIB-for-python.patch
    - 0003-cmake-set-install-paths-for-conda-builds.patch
    - 0004-man-set-section-7-for-classads-man-page.patch
    - 0005-python-don-t-link-against-libpython.patch
    - 0006-python-link-against-libcondor_utils-as-external.patch
    - 0007-osx-use-pre-installed-openssl-libraries.patch
    - 0008-osx-don-t-run-macosx_rewrite_libs.patch
    - 0009-python-use-conda-placeholder-shebang.patch
    - 0010-fix-building-against-openssl3.patch
  sha256: e261d2d90edb9aa33f6657383780793d53e48786b8669330858e0076185d036d
  url: https://research.cs.wisc.edu/htcondor/tarball/10.0/10.0.6/release/condor-10.0.6-src.tar.gz
build:
  missing_dso_whitelist: null
  number: 0
  run_exports:
    - htcondor-classads >=10.0.6,<10.1.0a0
  string: h0eb51fd_0
requirements:
  build:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - _sysroot_linux-ppc64le_curr_repodata_hack 4 h43410cf_13
    - binutils_impl_linux-64 2.40 hf600244_0
    - binutils_impl_linux-ppc64le 2.40 hef43fe1_0
    - binutils_linux-ppc64le 2.40 h631d6fd_0
    - gcc_impl_linux-64 12.3.0 he2b93b0_0
    - gcc_impl_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h783c3ad_0
    - gcc_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h7a1d020_0
    - gxx_impl_linux-64 12.3.0 he2b93b0_0
    - gxx_impl_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h783c3ad_0
    - gxx_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 hbee9562_0
    - kernel-headers_linux-64 2.6.32 he073ed8_15
    - kernel-headers_linux-ppc64le 3.10.0 h23d7e6c_13
    - ld_impl_linux-64 2.40 h41732ed_0
    - ld_impl_linux-ppc64le 2.40 h2f009d6_0
    - libgcc-devel_linux-64 12.3.0 h8bca6fd_0
    - libgcc-devel_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h227d28a_0
    - libgcc-ng 13.1.0 he5830b7_0
    - libgomp 13.1.0 he5830b7_0
    - libsanitizer 12.3.0 h0f45ef3_0
    - libstdcxx-devel_linux-64 12.3.0 h8bca6fd_0
    - libstdcxx-devel_linux-ppc64le 12.3.0 h227d28a_0
    - libstdcxx-ng 13.1.0 hfd8a6a1_0
    - sysroot_linux-64 2.12 he073ed8_15
    - sysroot_linux-ppc64le 2.17 h23d7e6c_13
  host:
    - _libgcc_mutex 0.1 conda_forge
    - _openmp_mutex 4.5 2_gnu
    - bzip2 1.0.8 h4e0d66e_4
    - libgcc-ng 13.1.0 h39a4be8_0
    - libgomp 13.1.0 h39a4be8_0
    - libstdcxx-ng 13.1.0 h09f375a_0
    - libzlib 1.2.13 ha17a0cc_5
    - pcre2 10.40 h02375f6_0
  run:
    - libgcc-ng >=12
    - libstdcxx-ng >=12
    - pcre2 >=10.40,<10.41.0a0
test:
  commands:
    - classad_version
about:
  description: 'Classified Advertisements (classads) are the lingua franca of

    HTCondor. They are used for describing jobs, workstations, and other

    resources. They are exchanged by HTCondor processes to schedule

    jobs. They are logged to files for statistical and debugging

    purposes. They are used to enquire about current state of the system.


    A classad is a mapping from attribute names to expressions. In the

    simplest cases, the expressions are simple constants (integer,

    floating point, or string). A classad is thus a form of property

    list. Attribute expressions can also be more complicated. There is a

    protocol for evaluating an attribute expression of a classad vis a vis

    another ad. For example, the expression "other.size > 3" in one ad

    evaluates to true if the other ad has an attribute named size and the

    value of that attribute is (or evaluates to) an integer greater than

    three. Two classads match if each ad has an attribute requirements

    that evaluates to true in the context of the other ad. Classad

    matching is used by the HTCondor central manager to determine the

    compatibility of jobs and workstations where they may be run.

    '
  dev_url: https://github.com/htcondor/htcondor
  doc_url: https://htcondor.readthedocs.io/
  home: http://htcondor.org/
  license: Apache-2.0
  license_family: APACHE
  license_file: LICENSE
  summary: HTCondor's classified advertisement language
extra:
  copy_test_source_files: true
  feedstock-name: htcondor
  final: true
  recipe-maintainers:
    - duncanmmacleod
    - jasoncpatton
    - timtheisen
